I'd highly recommend "Hitch" for you, a fascinating documentary that delves into one of the most historic meetings between two legendary filmmakers, Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut. It's an intriguing insight into their discussions about cinema.

If you're looking for something more personal and contemporary, "Restless" might be up your alley. This film explores themes of love, freedom, and change in the lives of a group of young adults, beautifully portrayed by a talented ensemble cast including Mia Wasikowska and Hayley Atwell.

Another great option is "Man on Wire", a riveting story about Philippe Petit's legendary high-wire walk between the Twin Towers, featuring Jean-Louis Blondeau and Paul McGill. Both films are thought-provoking and showcase extraordinary human stories. Enjoy!
